citation.article-title: Classification of Lactobacillus divergens, Lactobacillus piscicola, and some catalase-negative asporogenous, rod-shaped bacteria from poultry in a new genus, Carnobacterium.

p.s: Description of Carnobacterium mobile sp. nov.
Carnobacterium mobile (mo'bi.le. L. neut. adj. mobile, movable or motile)
Gram-positive, nonsporeforming, straight, slender rods which occur singly or in short chains.
Cells are motile.
Colonies are white, convex, shiny, and circular.
Growth occurs at 0 and 35°C (some strains do not grow at 37°C) but not at 40°C.
Facultatively anaerobic.
L-(+)-Lactic acid is produced heterofermentatively.
Gas production from glucose is observed for most strains in arginine-MRS broth.
Acid is produced from cellobiose, D-fructose, galactose, D-glucose, inulin, maltose, D-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, D-ribose, salicin, sucrose, and trehalose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, amidon, amygdalin, D-arabinose, L-arabinose, D-arabitol, L-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D-fucose, L-fucose, glycogen, gluconate, inositol, 5-ketogluconate, lactose, D-lyxose, mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, α-methyl-D-glucoside, α-methyl-D-mannoside, β-methyl-D-xyloside, raffinose, L-rhamnose, sorbitol, L-sorbose, D-turanose, D-xylose, L-xylose, and xylitol.
Some strains produce acid from β-gentiobiose, 2-ketogluconate, and D-tagatose.
All strains hydrolyze esculin and are arginine dihydrolase and β-galactosidase positive.
All strains are lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan desaminase, and urease negative.
Indole and H2S are not produced, Voges-Proskauer negative.
The cell wall peptidoglycan contains mess-diaminopimelic acid.
The cellular fatty acids are of the straight-chain saturated and monounsaturated types, with hexadecanoic, hexadecenoic, and 9,lO-octadecenoic acids predominating.
The G+C content of DNA ranges from 35.5 to 37.2 mol% (midpoint melting temperature [Tm].
Isolated from irradiated chicken meat.
The type strain is NCFB 2765T (MT37L).
The description of the type strain corresponds to that of the species, except that growth occurs at 37°C, acid is produced from β-gentiobiose, and acid is not produced from D-tagatose.
